premises: The program executes successfully or the program generates an error but not both at the same time
The program does not execute successfully
conclusions: Not generating an error implies the program executes successfully
incorrect conclusions: The program does not generate an error
If the program executes successfully, then it generates an error
If the program generates an error, then it executes successfully

premises: The server is online or the server is under maintenance but not both at the same time
conclusions: Not under maintenance implies the server is online
incorrect conclusions: The server is not under maintenance
If the server is online, then it is under maintenance
If the server is under maintenance, then it is online

premises: The user is authenticated or the user is denied access but not both at the same time
conclusions: Not being denied access implies the user is authenticated
incorrect conclusions: The user is not denied access
If the user is authenticated, then they are denied access
If the user is denied access, then they are authenticated
